his stake in the company has made him a centibillionaire, with an estimated net worth exceeding $360 billion in 2025, making him the world’s second‑richest person; beyond technology, Ellison is known for lavish spending, yachting, owning the Hawaiian island of Lanai, and significant media and philanthropic ventures.", "images": ["https://static.startuptalky.com/2021/09/Larry-Ellison-StartupTalky.jpg", "https://www.businessoutreach.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/larry-ellison-oracle.jpg", "https://cdn.britannica.com/43/199343-050-5A69C731/Larry-Ellison-2012.jpg", "https://theusleaders.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Larry-Ellison.png", "https://www.sun-sentinel.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/tfl-l-ellison-01.jpg?w=1020"], "results": [{"url": "https://www.amazon.com/Larry-Ellison-Biography-Complex-Genius/dp/B0DSDSMCMR", "title": "Larry Ellison Biography: The Complex Genius of Oracle - Amazon.com", "content": "Enter the enthralling world of Larry Ellison, the enigmatic co-founder of Oracle Corporation, whose rise from humble origins to become one of the wealthiest and most important individuals in technology is nothing short of extraordinary. output.answer: Larry Ellison, born August 17, 1944 in New York City and raised by adoptive parents in Chicago, left college early and taught himself programming while working at Ampex, where he built a database for the CIA; in 1977 he co‑founded Software Development Laboratories with Bob Miner and Ed Oates, later renamed Oracle Systems Corporation and then Oracle Corporation, launching the first commercial relational database based on Edgar F. Codd’s 1970 paper; he served as Oracle’s CEO from 1977 to 2014, then as chief technology officer and executive chairman, steering the company through rapid growth, landmark acquisitions such as PeopleSoft and Sun Microsystems, and the shift to cloud services; his stake in the company has made him a centibillionaire, with an estimated net worth exceeding $360 billion in 2025, making him the world’s second‑richest person; beyond technology, Ellison is known for lavish spending, yachting, owning the Hawaiian island of Lanai, and significant media and philanthropic ventures.

results.title: Larry Ellison Biography: The Complex Genius of Oracle - Amazon.com
results.content: Enter the enthralling world of Larry Ellison, the enigmatic co-founder of Oracle Corporation, whose rise from humble origins to become one of the wealthiest and most important individuals in technology is nothing short of extraordinary. In this captivating biography, readers will learn about the life and impact of a man who not only revolutionised database technology but also transformed the entire business landscape. Ellison was born in the Bronx and reared by his adoptive parents in Chicago, [...] examination of both accomplishments and losses, "Larry Ellison: The Visionary Behind Oracle" provides a captivating portrayal of a man who embodies the spirit of entrepreneurship. Whether you're an aspiring entrepreneur, a tech enthusiast, or just interested about one of Silicon Valley's most fascinating characters, this book will teach you essential lessons about resilience, invention, and the pursuit of perfection. [...] Discover how a love of computers fuelled his entrepreneurial spirit, prompting him to drop out of college and go on a path that culminated in the foundation of Oracle, a business that has become synonymous with innovation. This book looks deeply into Ellison's audacious vision, showing the techniques he used to negotiate strong competition and build Oracle into a global powerhouse. From pioneering relational databases to embracing cloud computing, Ellison's ability to anticipate industry trends

results.title: Larry Ellison: From College Dropout to Billionaire Oracle Founder
results.content:
Skip to Content

# Larry Ellison

Larry Ellison is the founder and former CEO of Oracle Corporation, making the billionaire one of the world’s wealthiest people.

By Biography.com Editors and Tyler Piccotti

Getty Images

> 1944–present

## Latest News: Larry Ellison Briefly Becomes World’s Richest Person [...] American businessman Larry Ellison is the co-founder of technology company Oracle Corporation. He served its CEO from 1977 through 2014 and is now the company’s chairman of the board and chief technology officer. Ellison holds a 41-percent stake in Oracle and is worth more than $369 billion as of September 2025, making him one of the world’s richest people.

## Quick Facts [...] Tyler Piccotti

News and Culture Editor, Biography.com

results.title: Larry Ellison - Wikipedia
results.content:
Lawrence Joseph Ellison (born August 17, 1944) is an American businessman and entrepreneur who co-founded the software company Oracle Corporation. He was Oracle's chief executive officer from 1977 to 2014 and is now its chief technology officer and executive chairman "Chair (officer)"). He is a centibillionaire and the second-richest person in the world as of November 2025. [...] During the 1970s, after a brief stint at Amdahl Corporation, Ellison began working for Ampex Corporation. His first project included a database for the CIA, code-named "Oracle". Ellison was inspired by a paper written by Edgar F. Codd on relational database systems called "A Relational Model of Data for Large Shared Data Banks". In 1977, he founded Software Development Laboratories (SDL) with two partners and an investment of $2,000; $1,200 of the money was his. Although he had strong technical [...] ## Books

[edit]

 Symonds, Matthew; Ellison, Larry (2004). Softwar: An Intimate Portrait of Larry Ellison and Oracle. New York: Simon & Schuster. ISBN "ISBN (identifier)") 978-0-7432-2505-2. OCLC "OCLC (identifier)") 52638805.

## Recognition

[edit]

In 1997, Ellison received the Golden Plate Award of the American Academy of Achievement.

In 2013, Ellison was inducted into the Bay Area Business Hall of Fame.

results.title: The Difference Between God and Larry Ellison by Mike Wilson
results.content:
This is a biography of Larry Ellison, the founder of Oracle and the “playboy” billionaire. Larry manages to somehow fly under the radar, despite being the 2nd richest man in the world (at the time of me writing this). Yet, as Mike explains in this book, Larry’s very large ego wants him to be known. [...] Larry started Oracle with $1200 and grew it to a multi-billion-dollar company. This book is all about how he did that. It is filled with incredible stories, including a legal case he was caught in with an ex-girlfriend/employee, conversations with Steve Jobs, and a war with Bill Gates.

## My favourite parts

I’m a bit of a sucker for stories about Steve Jobs. Steve and Larry deeply admired each other, and reading about some of their interactions was awesome.

results.title: Larry Ellison | Oracle Cofounder, AI Advocate, & Media Investor
results.content:
Larry Ellison (born August 17, 1944, New York City, New York) is an American businessman and entrepreneur who cofounded the software company Oracle Corporation (ORCL) and was its chief executive officer (CEO) from 1977 to 2014. As of 2025, he was the company’s executive chair and chief technology officer (CTO).

## Early life and education [...] Introduction & Quick Facts
 Early life and education
 Founding and growth of Oracle
 Internet era and acquisitions
 AI and cloud infrastructure leadership
 Legal and regulatory challenges
 Media investments and cultural influence
 Wealth, public image, and legacy

Read More

Bill GatesOracle Corp.Steve Jobs

Larry Ellison, 2012.

in full:
:   Lawrence Joseph Ellison

Founder:
:   Oracle Corp.

News

 • [...] Known for his aggressive business style and conspicuous spending, Ellison was long regarded as one of Silicon Valley’s most divisive figures. An avid yachtsman, he founded a team that won the America’s Cup in 2010, and in 2012 he purchased nearly all of the Hawaiian island of Lanai. His career came to be seen as spanning two eras of modern business, from the rise of enterprise software to the global expansion of AI and digital media.

Erik GregersenMark Hall

results.title: Larry Ellison: The unconventional billionaire and his family office
results.content:
##### Lawrence Joseph Ellison is one of the world’s most enigmatic billionaires. As a two-time college dropout and a personal friend of the late Steve Jobs and Elon Musk, he has built a reputation for his bold, unconventional approaches to business and lifestyle. As the founder and former CEO of Oracle Corporation, he has chartered a unique path in the tech industry and beyond. This case study examines his early life, career, the beginnings of Oracle, his philanthropy, and finally, his family [...] Having chosen the unconventional path, Larry’s life has played out much like an epic movie. In fact, in 2010, he was featured in the Iron Man 2 movie, where he played himself as a character called the “Oracle of Oracle.”

As he enters his eighth decade, with his sixth wife, full of vibrancy and vigour, he remains Oracle’s Executive Chairman and Chief Technology Officer, guiding the company’s vision.His ambition is quite simple: to beat Amazon in cloud database. [...] Larry established his family office, Lawrence Investments, LLC, in 1977, the same year he started Oracle. It operates as a private venture and investment firm, primarily serving his and his family’s personal wealth. The firm’s main goal is to manage and grow Larry’s considerable personal wealth. And the majority of it is tied up in his personal stake at Oracle.

results.title: Meet Larry Ellison, Co-founder of Oracle. ...
results.content:
Meet Larry Ellison, Co-founder of Oracle. Larry took an unconventional path to success, overcoming many challenges along the way. He left college without finishing his degree and struggled early in his career. In 1977, he took a big risk and Co-founded Oracle with just $2,000. Over time, he built it into one of the most powerful tech companies in the world. At one point, his wife told him he lacked ambition, which led to their separation. But Ellison never lost confidence in his vision. Instead [...] Need to start the story from the beginning and be accurate , prior to Oracle (aka CIA Project Oracle) the company was called Software Development Laboratories (SDL) Larry Ellison, Bob Miner, and Ed Oates founded SDL. Later in either 1979 or 1980 they changed the name company name to the flagship database name, which was Project Oracle for the CIA. This is what helped launch Oracle to being what is today.

LikeReply1 Reaction 2 Reactions 

See more comments
To view or add a comment, sign in [...] of giving up, he used those setbacks as fuel to keep going. Ellison’s story proves one thing - when you bet on yourself and refuse to quit, the world takes notice. Be relentless you in the pursuit of your vision.

results.title: the incredible rags-to-riches story of Oracle founder Larry ...
results.content:
Before he founded Oracle, the database software firm that made his fortune, Ellison grew up in a working-class Chicago family of Jewish immigrants.

"I was raised on the South Side of Chicago," he said in an oral history for the Smithsonian Institution. "I remember Look Magazine called it the oldest and worst black ghetto in the United States." [...] In his oral history, he recalled, "I never took a computer science class in my life. I got a job working as a programmer; I was largely self-taught. I just picked up a book and started programming."

When he landed a programming job at Ampex Corporation, Business Insider's Madeline Stone notes that one of Ellison's responsibilities at the company was building a database for the CIA. In 1977, he and two coworkers left Ampex to start a database management company of their own. [...] But becoming a billionaire was never his goal, he told the Smithsonian Institution. "When I started Oracle, what I wanted to do was to create an environment where I would enjoy working. That was my primary goal. Sure, I wanted to make a living. I certainly never expected to become rich, certainly not this rich."

Story Continues

Now 70, Ellison has a lifestyle that he could only have dreamed of during his working-class Chicago childhood.

results.title: Oracle CEO History: From Ellison to Catz
results.content:
# ORACLE CEO HISTORY

© History Oasis / Created via Midjourney

## LIST OF CEOS OF ORACLE

‍

 Larry Ellison - co-founder & CEO (1977–2014)
 Mark Hurd - co-CEO (2014–2019)
 Safra Catz - co-CEO (2014–present)

‍

## LARRY ELLISON (CO-FOUNDER OF ORACLE)

‍

Larry Ellison led Oracle Corporation as the tech startup's CEO from its founding in 1977 until 2014, transforming a startup into the world's second-largest software company. [...] His 37-year tenure centered on database technology innovation and strategic acquisitions.

In the 1980s, Ellison established Oracle Database as the market leader in relational database technology.

He then expanded Oracle's reach through calculated purchases of competitors, including PeopleSoft and Sun Microsystems, which secured Oracle's position in enterprise applications and hardware.

Ellison's aggressive leadership style produced both triumphs and failures.
